verses.text: 因此，你們既然是蒙愛的兒女，就應當效法 神。

words.note: Often used to describe those blessed or favored by God.
The preceding space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 要憑著愛心行事，好像基督愛我們，為我們捨己，當作馨香的供品和祭物獻給 神。

words.note: A key concept in Christian discipleship.
Often used in the Bible for offerings pleasing to God.
The preceding space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 至於淫亂和任何污穢或貪心的事，在你們中間連提都不可提，才合聖徒的體統。

words.note: A reduplicated negative construction for emphasis.
Refers to what is appropriate for one's status or identity.

verses.text: 更不要講淫穢和愚妄的話，或下流的笑話，這些都與你們不相稱；卻要說感謝的話。
因為你們確實知道，無論是淫亂的、污穢的或貪心的，都得不到在基督和 神的國裡的基業。

words.note: Turns the preceding adjective/verb into a noun (e.g., 'the immoral one').
Turns the preceding adjective/verb into a noun (e.g., 'the impure one').
Turns the preceding adjective/verb into a noun (e.g., 'the greedy one').
The preceding space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Often combined with location nouns like '國' to mean 'in the kingdom'.

verses.text: 要作光明的兒女不要給別人用空言欺騙了你們，正因為這些事， 神的震怒必定臨到那些悖逆的人。

words.note: Lit. 'sons and daughters'
Refers to the singular God, often used for 'God' or 'a god'.

verses.text: 所以，不要與他們同流合污。

words.definition: to wallow in the mire with, to be corrupted
words.note: Idiom, 'to flow together and join in defilement'.

verses.text: 你們從前是黑暗的，現今在主裡卻是光明的，行事為人就應當像光明的兒女。

words.note: Compound for 'way of life, conduct'.

verses.text: 光明所結的果子，就是一切良善、公義、誠實。

words.note: Used as a noun, referring to the spiritual light.
Indicates the following verb's object or passive voice.
In biblical context, implies moral goodness.
In biblical context, often refers to truthfulness or faithfulness.

verses.text: 你們要察驗甚麼是主所喜悅的。

words.note: Indicates the following verb's object or passive voice.

verses.text: 不要參與暗昧無益的事，倒要把它揭露出來，

words.note: Often used to describe morally dark or shameful things.
Used as a directional complement indicating emergence.

verses.text: 因為他們暗中所作的事，連提起來也是羞恥的。

words.note: Indicates something done or that which is done.

verses.text: 凡被光揭露的，都是顯而易見的。

words.note: Literally 'display and easy to see'.

verses.text: 因為一切顯露出來的就是光，所以有話說：「睡了的人哪，醒過來，從死人中起來吧！基督必要照亮你。」

words.note: Used as a directional complement indicating emergence.
Indicates exclamation or entreaty.
Used as a resultative complement.
Refers to deceased individuals or the realm of the dead.
Can be a directional complement or a verb itself.
Stronger than 'will'; denotes certainty.

verses.text: 所以，你們行事為人要謹慎，不要像愚昧人，卻要像聰明人。

words.note: A set phrase describing one's behavior or conduct in life.

verses.text: 要把握時機，因為這時代邪惡。

words.note: Commonly used in scripture to describe moral evil.

verses.text: 因此，不要作糊塗人，要明白甚麼是主的旨意。

words.note: Used to refer to God or Christ in religious texts.
Often refers to God's will or decree.

verses.text: 不要醉酒，醉酒能使人放蕩亂性，卻要讓聖靈充滿。

words.note: Refers to the act of being intoxicated, often discouraged in scripture.
Refers to the state of intoxication.
A fixed phrase describing licentious and corrupt behavior.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 應當用詩章、聖詩、靈歌，彼此呼應，口唱心和地讚美主。

words.note: Refers to poetic scriptures, specifically the Book of Psalms.
Refers to sacred songs or hymns sung in worship.
Songs inspired by the Holy Spirit or with spiritual themes.
An idiom meaning to sing with both voice and spirit, in harmony.
Used to refer to God or Christ in religious texts.

verses.text: 凡事要奉我們主耶穌基督的名，常常感謝父 神，

words.note: Literally 'to offer respectfully', used in a religious context for 'in the name of'.
Used to refer to God or Christ in religious texts.
Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 還要存敬畏基督的心，彼此順服。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts, meaning 'reverent fear'.
Common in religious contexts, especially regarding authority.

verses.text: 丈夫與妻子你們作妻子的，要順服自己的丈夫，好像順服主一樣，

words.note: Used to make a phrase into a noun, e.g., 'those who are wives'.
Refers to Christ or God in religious contexts.

verses.text: 因為丈夫是妻子的頭，好像基督是教會的頭；基督又是教會全體的救主。
教會怎樣順服基督，妻子也要照樣凡事順服丈夫。
你們作丈夫的，要愛妻子，好像基督愛教會，為教會捨己，

words.note: Used to make a phrase into a noun, e.g., 'those who are husbands'.
A classical/biblical term for self-sacrifice.

verses.text: 為的是要用水藉著道把教會洗淨，成為聖潔，

words.note: Refers to divine truth or the Bible.
Lit. 'teaching assembly'.
Describes a state of ritual and moral purity.

verses.text: 可以作榮耀的教會歸給自己，甚麼污點皺紋等也沒有，而是聖潔沒有瑕疵的。

words.note: Often refers to divine majesty or honor.

words.definition: to give to, to return to

verses.text: 丈夫也應當這樣愛妻子，好像愛自己的身體一樣。愛妻子的，就是愛自己了。

words.note: Here, 'the one who loves his wife'.

verses.text: 從來沒有人恨惡自己的身體，總是保養顧惜，好像基督對教會一樣，

words.note: Often used in pairs with 保養 for holistic care.

verses.text: 因為我們是他身上的肢體。

words.note: Figuratively, a member of a group or community.

verses.text: 為了這緣故，人要離開父母，與妻子結合，二人成為一體。

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts, meaning 'on account of this'.
More formal than 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).
Can refer to marriage or other forms of union.
Figurative usage describing marital union or unity within the church.

verses.text: 這是極大的奧祕，但我是指著基督和教會說的。

words.note: Refers to a divine secret or spiritual truth revealed by God.
Used here to emphasize the speaker's role in the statement.
Refers to the Christian church or assembly of believers.
Used in the '是...的' (shì...de) construction to emphasize the manner or agent of an action.

verses.text: 無論怎樣，你們各人都要愛自己的妻子，好像愛自己一樣。妻子也應當敬重丈夫。

words.note: Often used with '好像' (hǎoxiàng) to mean 'just like...'
Conveys a sense of deep respect and reverence.
